name: 郭無患
objective:
一、教學目標（Teaching Objectives）
本課程旨在讓學生具備國際新聞編譯之相關知識，並透過實務演練培養新聞編譯之能力。課程內容主要含括 (一) 國際新聞編譯之介紹（如新聞編譯現況、製作流程、專業條件與譯者相關知能）；（二）新聞編譯之策略與技巧（如刪除、重組、整合新聞訊息）；（三）新聞編譯之模擬與實務練習。
本課程提供閱讀新聞英語的練習機會，藉著閱讀報紙、雜誌英文新聞報導、評論、專欄、社論等，了解其中新聞字彙、文體，訓練閱讀新聞。
促使學生透過媒體識讀教學過程、瞭解新聞編採實務、國際現勢、配合原本的英文能力利基，強化國際觀，落實並活用英文。
本課程重要目標並包含著重加強應用英文系學生對國際新聞編譯實務的能力，培養學生敏銳的觀察力及組織力、並訓練學生對國際時事的新聞陳述與課堂討論，達到不同觀點的看法。有系統引導學生閱讀國際新聞，述說新國際聞編譯之寫作方式與要點，以及編譯技巧，培養未來可能於新聞職場服務的專業能力。

I. Teaching Objectives

This course is designed to equip students with foundational knowledge and practical skills in the translation and adaptation of international news. Through both theoretical instruction and hands-on practice, students will develop competencies essential to news translation. The course content includes:

An introduction to international news translation, covering current practices, production processes, required professional qualifications, and the essential knowledge and skills of translators;

Strategies and techniques for news translation, such as omission, restructuring, and the integration of news information;

Simulated translation exercises and practical training.

Students will engage in extensive reading of English-language news content from newspapers, magazines, commentaries, columns, and editorials to become familiar with journalistic vocabulary and styles, thereby enhancing their news reading comprehension.

The course further aims to strengthen students’ global awareness by integrating media literacy, an understanding of newsroom practices, and current international affairs, leveraging their existing English proficiency to actively apply the language in real-world contexts.

A key objective is to enhance the practical capabilities of English majors in international news translation, fostering sharp observation, organizational skills, and the ability to articulate and discuss global news issues. The course will systematically guide students in reading and analyzing international news, introducing key writing approaches, translation methods, and editorial techniques—ultimately preparing them for potential careers in the media industry.

IV. Teaching Materials

Primary Sources:
This course utilizes current reports and analyses of major international events from leading global news outlets, including The Associated Press (AP), Cable News Network (CNN), The Economist, Time, The Wall Street Journal, The Washington Post, and The Financial Times. Materials will be presented in various formats, including written articles, images, and multimedia content (audio and video).
